statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.description: Field Goal makes and attempts.

statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.name: rebounds
statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

statistics.name: offensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the offense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot.

article.headline: Florida State 85, McNeese State 65
article.story: TALLAHASSEE, Fla. (AP) -- Al Thornton scored 17 points and Uche Echefu added 14 Sunday night as Florida State defeated McNeese State 85-65 at the opening round of the Colonial Classic in the first game of the year for both schools. In the first game of the three-day round robin, Southern Methodist defeated Illinois State 57-55 on Devon Pearson's tip-in on a missed shot as the buzzer sounded. It was also the first game of the year for them. Florida State wiped out an early 11-point deficit and led by as many as 26 points in the second half, shooting a blistering 67 percent from the floor. Echefu's successive 3-point baskets five minutes into the second half gave Florida State a 45-39 lead to spark a second half runaway. He scored 10 points in a four-minute span to key a 16-5 run. "We need him to play that type of role for us," Florida State coach Leonard Hamilton said. "I was glad to see him step away from the basket and knock two jumpers down." McNeese, from the Southland Conference, jumped off to a 14-4 lead and built its advantage to 24-13 with 8:32 left in the half on Rorey Lawrence's 3-point shot. "Their superior depth wore us down late in the game," McNeese coach Dave Simmons said. "They kept coming with fresh people. We were tough for about 20 minutes." John Ford led the Cowboys with 19 points while Lawrence and Aldryan Wardell each scored 11. Wardell also had a game best eight rebounds. Eleven players scored for the Seminoles while McNeese only had eight suited for the game. Florida State, which was left out of last season's NCAA tournament despite a 20-10 record and winning mark as well in the Atlantic Coast Conference, didn't catch up until 1:28 left in the half on two Ralph Mims free throws. Jason Rich's short jumper with 26 seconds left in the half gave Florida State a 36-35 lead at the break. Rich and Toney Douglas, a transfer from Auburn, scored 12 points apiece for the Seminoles, who shot 53.3 percent from the floor despite a terrible start. The Seminoles started ice cold, scoring just four points in the game's first eight minutes. Florida State meets Illinois State following the SMU-McNeese game in Monday's second round.
